page.title: 11Margam Park Orangery Gardens
page.content: These formal gardens cover an area of 27 acres. The Broad Walk leading from the castle is noted for its rhododend- rons as is Fishpond. The bamboo garden is largely overgrown. Notable specimen trees include a Wellingtonia, 37m, a fine fern leaved Beech 18x20m, Oriental Plane, 3 Tulip Trees, and in front of the Orangery 2 ancient Stone Pines and an Aleppo Pine. Trees and shrubs with dark green foliage predominate in the lower garden where the orange trees were stood out in summer months. Here a fantasy village is being constructed depicting houses and characters from Folk tales and Nursery rhymes. A pergola 450 metres long is being built clothed with climbing plants of every description.
